page.title: 09QUADRING PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Quadring Cowley and Brown's Primary School dates from the 1720's. It was set up with rent from land left by two local land owners. The school still receives money from this source at the discretion of the Charity Trustees. Initially it was a boarding school, part of the original building is still standing, but now it is a two teacher primary school with approximately 46 children. Most of the pupils live in Quadring but some travel by car from Donington. Those from the village either walk or cycle along a footpath which runs directly from the village to the school. On leaving this school children either go to the secondary school in Donington or Grammar or High in Spalding.
